programme.category: Comedy, Romance, Comedy, Romance
programme.review: --- Actors: Jessica Alba (role=Morley Clarkson), Kathy Bates (role=Susan), Jessica Biel (role=Kara Monahan), Bradley Cooper (role=Holden), Eric Dane (role=Sean Jackson), Patrick Dempsey (role=Dr. Harrison Copeland), Hector Elizondo (role=Edgar), Jamie Foxx (role=Kelvin Moore), Jennifer Garner (role=Julia Fitzpatrick), Topher Grace (role=Jason), Anne Hathaway (role=Liz), Carter Jenkins (role=Alex)

IMDb data; ttnr: 0817230, Title: Valentine's Day, --- Description: Valentine's Day: Directed by Garry Marshall. With Jessica Alba, Kathy Bates, Jessica Biel, Bradley Cooper. Intertwining couples and singles in Los Angeles break-up and make-up based on the pressures and expectations of Valentine's Day." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0817230/","name":"Valentine's Day","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTk3MTIwNDIxNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDMyMzcwMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Intertwining couples and singles in Los Angeles break-up and make-up based on the pressures and expectations of Valentine's Day.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0817230/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"mchael_skunk","dateCreated":"2010-02-14","inLanguage":"English","name":"cheesy rom-com","reviewBody":"Valentine's Day is a who's who of famous people, a very Hollywood romance movie with a severe case of A.D.D. Most stars check in as if paying back some favour to the director. It is a people movie full of people for the Facebook generation. Is it serious film-making? Well, it's one of those films that has bloopers during the credits, so definitely not; so we shouldn't judge it on that. It's simply a schmaltzy whimsical chick flick. The film takes place over one fine Valentine's Day from early morning to late at night in flawless Hollywood California. We follow random individuals, who are each connected within 5 degrees of each other, as they deal with love. The movie has been marketed as being choc-block full of superstars, so lets see how they did. Kathy Bates has two scenes, I completely forgot she was in it until the second time she popped up, She is very likable as the butch TV News executive who is the boss of career driven Kelvin Moore (Jamie Foxx), a B-Grade sports commentator trying to make his mark, but given a vox-pops job. Foxx seems way too charming to be such an unlikeable character, as publicist Kara (Jessica Biel) slowly falls for him, but we're not really given enough time as we cut to florist Reed (Ashton Kutcher) a hopeless romantic who has fallen for Morley (Jessica Alba), and Julia (Jennifer Garner) in a 30-something love triangle. Garner is a teacher at a primary school where young Edison (Bryce Robinson) has his first crush, and desperately tries to send his mystery girl a special delivery. Robinson brings the cute to this movie, and holds his own against the army of celebrities he's acting with, namely Shirley MacLaine as Edison's grandmother, Estelle. Estelle is a Golden Age Actress, (MacLaine playing herself, as we see from actual footage of MacLaine in 1958's Hot Spell) who is in a fifty year marriage with Edgar (Hector Elizondo). Both performances are top notch, Elizondo arguably the best in the entire film. He is soulful, gentle, and wise. For the teens, the majority market, we have Grace and Alex (Emma Roberts and Carter Jenkins) awkwardly trying to plan the next level of their relationship in scenes right out of the American Pie book on how to write teen comedy, and Willy and Felicia (Taylor Lautner and Taylor Swift) the jock and the bimbo, who 13 to 19 year old girls will literally cheer at the screen for, yet they bring little. Swift is cringe-worthy and Lautner makes an out of place reference to his abs that is just odd in the context of the film. We also have Liz (Anne Hathaway in a solid enough comedic performance, she does funny voices) who moonlights as a phone sex operator, and hides this from boyfriend of two weeks Jason (Topher Grace, slighty less annoying than usual). Also thrown into the mix is McDreamy as the cheating swine Dr. Harrison Copeland, and McSteamy as ageing single footballer Sean Jackson. Stuck on a plane are Holden and Captain Kate Hazeltine (Bradley Cooper, and Julia Roberts), as they meet, and chat, and flirt, and seem like those two old grumpy muppets in the booth. Queen Latifah also features as Liz's evil boss Paula Thomas who delivers the biggest laugh in the movie, right at the end. Alphonso (George Lopez) also stars as Kutcher's co-worker and go-to-guy for the Valentine's Day blues. Every actor does a good enough job of playing movie versions of themselves and no one tries to steal the show or go over the top crazy, but the amount of stars in the movie work both for it and against it. It is a very unique romance film, and is good for people who are likely to get sick of the same two actors, but we really don't see enough of anyone to care, or even follow what's going on. Characters are thrown at us, and before we have a moment to connect, we cut to someone else, and this happens for two straight hours as love, romance, sex, and relationships are examined and theorized. It's like a fish bowl with way too many fish, but we get to see characters just enough to get a laugh or two in. The film tries to find the true meaning of Valentine's Day, and the true meaning of love, in a cutesy comedic way. It's modern and fun, but very shallow on the surface.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":116859,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.7,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Romance"],"datePublished":"2010-02-10","keywords":"grandmother grandson relationship,grandfather grandson relationship,car,barefoot male,man wrapped in a towel","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Valentine's Day -- International Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2244215833","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA4NTY5NzEyMF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjk3ODYzMzE@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA4NTY5NzEyMF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjk3ODYzMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Intertwining couples and singles in Los Angeles break-up and make-up based on the pressures and expectations of Valentine's Day.","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000210/","name":"Julia Roberts","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004937/","name":"Jamie Foxx","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004266/","name":"Anne Hathaway"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005190/","name":"Garry Marshall"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046718/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0176486/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0033868/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0297545/","name":"Katherine Fugate","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0463359/","name":"Abby Kohn","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0799050/","name":"Marc Silverstein"],"duration":"PT2H5M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Friends with Benefits
Freunde mit gewissen Vorzügen
programme.desc:
Friends with Benefits: Directed by Will Gluck. With Justin Timberlake, Mila Kunis, Patricia Clarkson, Jenna Elfman. A young man and woman decide to take their friendship to the next level without becoming a couple, but soon discover that adding sex only leads to complications." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1632708/","name":"Friends with Benefits","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ2MzQ0NTk4N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDc2NDYzNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A young man and woman decide to take their friendship to the next level without becoming a couple, but soon discover that adding sex only leads to complications.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1632708/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"DonFishies"},"dateCreated":"2011-07-05","inLanguage":"English","name":"A raunchy sex comedy that starts off sweet but becomes sour all too quickly","reviewBody":"I was unsure what to expect going into Friends with Benefits at an advanced screening a few weeks ago. It always seemed a bit too close in plot to No Strings Attached (made extra odd as the female leads Mila Kunis and Natalie Portman had literally just starred together in Black Swan), a film that came out less than six months ago, and while the trailers looked amusing, they seemed to look a little too close to an atypical romantic comedy. But the film actually ended up surprising me. Well, the first half at least.

Jamie (Kunis) is a headhunter in New York City who helps aspiring graphic design artist Dylan (Justin Timberlake) land a prestigious job at GQ. They become good friends, and after a discussion about their relationship failures, decide to start having sex without the relationship schmaltz (hence the titular phrase). But the good times cannot stay uncomplicated for long.

Rather surprisingly, the first half of Friends with Benefits is a ridiculously raunchy sex comedy that is sweeter than it is crude. The dialogue and one-liners drop at a steady pace, and there is plenty of laugh out loud moments. I was genuinely surprised at just how much I was enjoying the film, and how well co-writer/director Will Gluck (who knocked Easy A out of the park last year) helped capture the tropes and stereotypes of romantic comedies, and went entirely against them. The scene that starts the initial sexual antics is a complete dissection of the genre, and seeing the film twist and turn around the familiar plot devices was wonderful to see. It made the film feel hilarious, but also made it feel like it was attempting to do something different at the same time. Adding in a couple of random cameos from notable actors was a bit wacky (which the trailers have ruined slightly), but helped add to the humour.

Except the film comes to a screeching halt just about halfway in when Jamie and Dylan come to the all too obvious realization that they may want something more. The film then becomes drastically more dramatic, a lot less sweet, and significantly more ordinary. Even the laughs suffer, landing less with a snicker and more with a groan. Everything it does to shift itself away from the romantic comedy genre feels wasted because it falls into all of the stereotypes quicker than it poked fun at them. It almost feels like they wanted to desperately feel different, and then decided to just go the safer route as opposed to sticking with its offbeat early tactics. I was really enjoying the film significantly more than I imagined, but suddenly felt bored and totally thrown off by the drastic tonal shift.

While sketch comedy has proved to be one of his strong suits, Timberlake seems to have a lot of trouble carrying the film. We know he has the chops to command the screen and be absolutely magnetic (we have David Fincher and The Social Network to thank for that), but here he seems to be struggling with every other scene. He lands most of his jokes well, does decently with the dramatic bits and has plenty of chemistry with Kunis, but he lacks the spark I think most people will expect him to have in this role. He comes off as just okay, and more amateur than anything else. He would have been better suited in the film as a key supporting player, as opposed to the lead.

Kunis on the other hand, is significantly stronger and proves that her turn in Forgetting Sarah Marshall may have been an early suggestion of the formidable comedic talent she may quickly become. Gluck is not able to achieve the same level of breakthrough that he got from Emma Stone in Easy A from Kunis, but she manages to carry the film almost single handedly. Even at the script's weakest moments, she grins and pushes forward, never once appearing to be struggling as much as Timberlake does. I think my only complaint against her is that she spends a good portion of the film completely nude, yet ends up wearing all too obvious pasties under a white shirt in one scene. It seems more like a complaint against a horrendously bad editing and lighting decision than against her, but it was a scene that made her seemingly-realistic character feel a whole lot less believable.

Patricia Clarkson and Richard Jenkins both deliver good performances, but sadly feel like they are just plagiarizing from characters they have played better in the past. Jenna Elfman (who I did not realize was still acting) does a little better in a warm and significantly low-key role as Dylan's sister Annie. But it is Woody Harrelson who steals the entire show as gay sports writer Tommy. He plays the character ridiculously over-the-top, but never feels like he is encroaching on any stereotypes. He makes it his own, and is almost too good in the role. He gets all of the film's best dialogue quips, and runs circles around everyone on screen. In more than one instance, Timberlake looks legitimately shocked at some of the things Harrelson says and gets away with. I think the film could have only benefited from including more of him.

In the end, Friends with Benefits is both surprisingly well done and unsurprisingly ordinary. It tries so hard initially to be the anti- romantic comedy, and then just ends up falling into the same predictable elements that every other film in the genre has already done countless times before. The film is genuinely hilarious when it wants to be however, and this does save it from being a total waste. But it could have been so much more.

7/10.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":353331,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Romance"],"datePublished":"2011-07-22","keywords":"female rear nudity,blow job,no panties,oral sex,scantily clad female","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2190056729","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTYwMzE4OTc0OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzM3NzY3NA@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTYwMzE4OTc0OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzM3NzY3NA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The relationship between two friends (Justin Timberlake and Mila Kunis) gets complicated when they decide to get romantic. "},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005109/","name":"Mila Kunis"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005493/","name":"Justin Timberlake"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0165101/","name":"Patricia Clarkson"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0323239/","name":"Will Gluck"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0010568/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0040620/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0110404/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2226647/","name":"Keith Merryman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2226970/","name":"David A. Newman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0323239/","name":"Will Gluck"}],"duration":"PT1H49M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Trainwreck
Dating Queen
programme.desc: Trainwreck: Directed by Judd Apatow. With Colin Quinn, Devin Fabry, Carla Oudin, Amy Schumer. Having thought that monogamy was never possible, a commitment-phobic career woman may have to face her fears when she meets a good guy." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt3152624/","name":"Trainwreck","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ4MjgwNTMyOV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTc1MjI0NDE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Having thought that monogamy was never possible, a commitment-phobic career woman may have to face her fears when she meets a good guy.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3152624/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Rob-O-Cop"},"dateCreated":"2015-10-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"Mostly Unfunny, unredeemingly ugly, and a bit boring really.","reviewBody":"I really enjoy Amy's TV show and was expecting big things from this movie but ended up feeling I'd wasted my time watching it and it's off delivery leave a bad taste in the mouth. Was it that Amy just wasn't up to a feature length film or was it Judd Apatow's direction that made this not work. Where Amy's mischievous bad taste gender stereotype flipping gags work on her show, here they were missing the knowing nod. Amy fitted her self centered character's skin too well and at feature length you started to believe this was a real person and someone you wouldn't want to spend time with, even in a movie. Schummer was too ugly, and I don't mean that in a physical sense. Hader was good, as were most of the actors, apart from the product placement sports stars. IMDb data; ttnr: 3152624, Title: Trainwreck, --- Description: Trainwreck: Directed by Judd Apatow. With Colin Quinn, Devin Fabry, Carla Oudin, Amy Schumer. Having thought that monogamy was never possible, a commitment-phobic career woman may have to face her fears when she meets a good guy." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt3152624/","name":"Trainwreck","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ4MjgwNTMyOV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTc1MjI0NDE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Having thought that monogamy was never possible, a commitment-phobic career woman may have to face her fears when she meets a good guy.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3152624/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"Rob-O-Cop","dateCreated":"2015-10-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"Mostly Unfunny, unredeemingly ugly, and a bit boring really.","reviewBody":"I really enjoy Amy's TV show and was expecting big things from this movie but ended up feeling I'd wasted my time watching it and it's off delivery leave a bad taste in the mouth. Was it that Amy just wasn't up to a feature length film or was it Judd Apatow's direction that made this not work. Where Amy's mischievous bad taste gender stereotype flipping gags work on her show, here they were missing the knowing nod. Amy fitted her self centered character's skin too well and at feature length you started to believe this was a real person and someone you wouldn't want to spend time with, even in a movie. Schummer was too ugly, and I don't mean that in a physical sense. Hader was good, as were most of the actors, apart from the product placement sports stars. It really started to drag in the last 3rd, possibly because it had nowhere to go, which is exactly where it ended up.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":134000,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2015-08-26","keywords":"funeral,actress playing herself,actress shares first name with character,written by star,male nudity","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"International Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2692067353","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjMzMDI2MjIyN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzUyMzYwNjE@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjMzMDI2MjIyN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzUyMzYwNjE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Having thought that monogamy was never possible, a commitment-phobic career woman may have to face her fears when she meets a good guy.","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2154960/","name":"Amy Schumer","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0352778/","name":"Bill Hader","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0488953/","name":"Brie Larson"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0031976/","name":"Judd Apatow"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0073081/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0169264/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2154960/","name":"Amy Schumer"],"duration":"PT2H5M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Sahara
Sahara – Abenteuer in der Wüste
programme.desc: Sahara: Directed by Breck Eisner. With Jude Akuwudike, Mark Aspinall, Rakie Ayola, Christopher Bello. Master explorer Dirk Pitt goes on the adventure of a lifetime of seeking out a lost Civil War battleship known as the "Ship of Death" in the deserts of West Africa while helping a WHO doctor being hounded by a ruthless dictator." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0318649/","name":"Sahara","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjExOTM4NDUzNV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwOTgzNzczMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Master explorer Dirk Pitt goes on the adventure of a lifetime of seeking out a lost Civil War battleship known as the "Ship of Death" in the deserts of West Africa while helping a WHO doctor being hounded by a ruthless dictator.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0318649/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ma-cortes"},"dateCreated":"2005-05-27","inLanguage":"English","name":"Splendid adventure film with mesmerizing desert landscapes","reviewBody":"The film starts in the Richmond battle (1865) where a war ship is disappeared and is gone during modern time in that an archaeologists(Matthew McConaughey,Steve Zhan and William H.Macy) are looking for treasures on Africa. A physician (Penelope Cruz ) is investigating about an illness which is killing thousands people . Then they 'll take on ominous villains,evil Arabs,corrupt governments and many dangers until discover the enigmas. \n\nThe motion picture blends adventures, unstopped action,humor,a love story,tongue in cheek,tense and is enough amusing. From the beginning to end the adventures,action-packed and the fast movement is continuous, for that the film is pretty bemusing and isn't boring in spite of the longtime, as the run is two hours and some. The starring couple(Matthew MacConaughey and Steve Zahn) make a type of ¨buddy movie¨ both are top notch and very sympathetic.Penelope Cruz is attractive and enjoyable, this is her best film. The support cast is of first range (William H.Macy,Lambert Wilson,Delroy Lindo) and are excellent. Cinematography and musical score(Clint Mansell) is magnificent and riveting. Production design (Allan Cameron) is spellbound and the Sahara outdoors are spectaculars. The final confrontation between the starring and the enemies is breathtaking and impressive. It's a run and mill action film where the comedy and the giggles united to the action make the story very agreeable and stimulating. The picture well directed by Brick Eisner obtained a lot of success and achieved important box office, it was number one in United States and Europe. It's a real blockbuster. The yarn will appeal to emotion and adventure enthusiasts . Rating: Above average. Well worth seeing.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":95550,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2005-04-20","keywords":"beach,evil man,good versus evil,bare chested male,disguise","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Sahara","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2089091353","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDdlYjVlYjAtZTc2Ny00NzJjLWFlYjUtM2YyZjY3MjYyNGIyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDdlYjVlYjAtZTc2Ny00NzJjLWFlYjUtM2YyZjY3MjYyNGIyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Paramount Home Entertainment"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000190/","name":"Matthew McConaughey"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004851/","name":"Penélope Cruz"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001872/","name":"Steve Zahn"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0252135/","name":"Breck Eisner"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0023400/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0129170/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0145519/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0193774/","name":"Clive Cussler"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0232776/","name":"Thomas Dean Donnelly"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0649191/","name":"Joshua Oppenheimer"}],"duration":"PT2H4M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Astérix & Obélix: Mission Cléopâtre
Asterix und Obelix: Mission Kleopatra
programme.desc: Astérix & Obélix: Mission Cléopâtre: Directed by Alain Chabat. With Gérard Depardieu, Christian Clavier, Jamel Debbouze, Monica Bellucci. Astérix and Obélix go to Egypt to help architect Numérobis who is building a palace for Cleopatra." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0250223/","name":"Astérix & Obélix: Mission Cléopâtre","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2Q3NmUzNjAtM2VjMS00MGU3LWE4YjEtZTM1NDM0YTdlOWRkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODIyOTEyMzY@._V1_.jpg","description":"Astérix and Obélix go to Egypt to help architect Numérobis who is building a palace for Cleopatra.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0250223/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"jvanhalderen"},"dateCreated":"2002-09-27","inLanguage":"English","name":"The French are getting the hang of it!!","reviewBody":"Wow! the French are really getting the hang of it. If we look at their first Asterix movie we see a good story with nice actors (especially thanks to Gerard Depardeu)but very lame special effect. In a fantasy story like Asterix Special Effects are really important. Well.. they did it right this time! It looks terrific. I personaly think Mission Cleopatra is the best Asterix story ever written. In the movie there's not one moment you're bored. Go and watch this! One thing! they didnt go exactly by the script which I think is a little bit pittyful. For example, In the comic Obelix breaks the nose of the Sphinx, immediatly all the little storekeepers start breaking of the nose of their miniature Sphinx. (really funny to see)..Well they didnt put it in the movie, instead they burried the nose under the Sphinx. Asterix: "They will never look for it here" (guess again). Was funny but not as good as the original. Another thing i disliked about the movie was their choice for music. It maked the film to childies. But never the less... It's a must C!\n\nGrz Da Jean Holland","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":50999,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Adventure","Comedy","Family"],"datePublished":"2002-01-30","keywords":"architect,based on comic book,egypt,druid,cleopatra","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Bande-annonce [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1979890201","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2YyNTIxYzAtYzg2Yi00YzAyLThmYWEtOGQwYWJmZWU4MjM0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2YyNTIxYzAtYzg2Yi00YzAyLThmYWEtOGQwYWJmZWU4MjM0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000367/","name":"Gérard Depardieu"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002010/","name":"Christian Clavier"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0213354/","name":"Jamel Debbouze"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0149260/","name":"Alain Chabat"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0028557/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0090290/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0049807/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0331453/","name":"René Goscinny"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0879853/","name":"Albert Uderzo"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0149260/","name":"Alain Chabat"}],"duration":"PT1H47M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Taxi
New York Taxi
programme.desc: Taxi: Directed by Tim Story. With Queen Latifah, Jimmy Fallon, Henry Simmons, Jennifer Esposito. A mouthy and feisty taxicab driver has hot tips for a green and inept cop set on solving a string of New York City bank robberies committed by a quartet of female Brazilian bank robbers." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0316732/","name":"Taxi","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjlmZmU4ODEtYTIwZC00Y2Y0LTlhYmEtM2E5MTAwMjUzNTRkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTIzOTk5ODM@._V1_.jpg","description":"A mouthy and feisty taxicab driver has hot tips for a green and inept cop set on solving a string of New York City bank robberies committed by a quartet of female Brazilian bank robbers.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0316732/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"moonspinner55"},"dateCreated":"2005-10-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"Big budget comedy with cut-rate jokes...","reviewBody":"Slick, flashy film, a semi-remake of Luc Besson's "Taxi" from 1998, here Americanized as an urban action-comedy. Queen Latifah plays smart-mouthed cabbie with a souped-up vehicle in New York City who inadvertently partners with stumble bum cop Jimmy Fallon to crack a major crime case. Film should have relied more on Latifah's natural sass and less on Fallon's white-bread, dim-witted act (race is a constant punchline in the script, and Fallon is just there as Exhibit A). Jennifer Esposito is wonderful as a no-nonsense police lieutenant, Ann-Margret is a stitch as Fallon's tippling mother, and John Sierros (Broadway actor shamefully credited as 'Fat Cop') shines as a bamboozled police officer, but what happened to Queen Latifah? She gets a few good cracks in, but there's no character here for her to play; she sticks to her sarcastic persona and puts everyone down, but her role is depressingly one-dimensional. Comedy has a fast pace, impressive cinematography (although the swooping crane shots in traffic get repetitive) and some good car chases, but the screenplay needed an overhaul. ** from ****","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":4}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":41499,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.5},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Comedy","Crime"],"datePublished":"2004-10-06","keywords":"driving a car,car,automobile,convertible,bmw","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Taxi","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2256844313","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjk5MTMwNzQ0M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODgyNDMyMDI@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjk5MTMwNzQ0M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODgyNDMyMDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Taxi"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001451/","name":"Queen Latifah"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0266422/","name":"Jimmy Fallon"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1014528/","name":"Gisele Bündchen"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1103162/","name":"Tim Story"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0048273/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0033486/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000108/","name":"Luc Besson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0304830/","name":"Robert Ben Garant"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0502073/","name":"Thomas Lennon"}],"duration":"PT1H37M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: À fond
Full Speed
programme.desc:
À fond: Directed by Nicolas Benamou. With José Garcia, André Dussollier, Caroline Vigneaux, Charlotte Gabris. A family together with their grandpa go on a vacation, when their new car won't stop and it nearly escapes crashing into a hundred cars." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt4993964/","name":"À fond","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTgwNzU3ZWYtMmQ4Ny00NWNmLTk3ODgtNjJjYzI1NTE4YTUyL2ltYWdlL2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjgwMzE5OTI@._V1_.jpg","description":"A family together with their grandpa go on a vacation, when their new car won't stop and it nearly escapes crashing into a hundred cars.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt4993964/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Kryptorium"},"dateCreated":"2016-12-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"A comedy with adrenalin","reviewBody":"I had the opportunity to get a speech from the filmmaker (I went to the preview in Lyon) who indicated that some scenes weren't shot with a green screen. Knowing well this highway I trust him but not so much about the real speed (what's absolutely understandable according to stunts these actors accepted to do) ! This is doubtless the funnier movie of Nicolas Benamou but he has the merit to put successfully some scenes where we didn't expect to see them and to made the whole audience laugh.

I think my rate is not so high because some actors were not convincing enough and some clichés should have been enhanced further.

N.B. : some scenes are a bit violent (a child less than 10 left during one of them) ... so please avoid him that if yours is likely to have nightmares.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2921,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.8},"genre":["Action","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2016-12-21","keywords":"family","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0305296/","name":"José Garcia"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0244707/","name":"André Dussollier"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2404839/","name":"Caroline Vigneaux"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1318381/","name":"Nicolas Benamou"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0086916/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0006560/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0418621/","name":"Frédéric Jardin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0736676/","name":"Fabrice Roger-Lacan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1318381/","name":"Nicolas Benamou"}],"duration":"PT1H31M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: When Harry Met Sally..
Harry und Sally
programme.desc:
When Harry Met Sally...: Directed by Rob Reiner. With Billy Crystal, Meg Ryan, Carrie Fisher, Bruno Kirby. Harry and Sally have known each other for years, and are very good friends, but they fear sex would ruin the friendship." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0098635/","name":"When Harry Met Sally...","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjE0ODEwNjM2NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMjU2Mzg3NA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Harry and Sally have known each other for years, and are very good friends, but they fear sex would ruin the friendship.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0098635/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ajdagreat"},"dateCreated":"2001-06-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"not just a chick flick","reviewBody":"This movie is not just your average chick flick tearjerker romance movie. I'm sure that a lot of guys can relate to this movie as well.

 First of all, there are some hilarious lines in this movie that will appeal to men and women. Second, the orgasm scene in the restaurant has got to be one of the funniest scenes in movie history. And finally, the guys will be cheering on Billy Crystal, as he makes love to a LOT of women in this movie. I really enjoyed this movie, and I'm pretty sure that I am a guy (I'll check later). 

Billy Crystal and Meg Ryan will remind everyone of their everyday lives in this true-to-life (and very funny) movie. So guys, don't reject "When Harry Met Sally..." just because women cried at it. And girls, if you see this movie, you will probably want to see it another 50 times."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":206277,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"1989-07-21","keywords":"male female friendship,opposites attract,fake orgasm,new york,pessimist","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi129743385","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjYyZjk1ZDMtMGJmZC00YmI0LWJhYTYtYzA1MDcyN2JhOTU3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjYyZjk1ZDMtMGJmZC00YmI0LWJhYTYtYzA1MDcyN2JhOTU3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000345/","name":"Billy Crystal"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000212/","name":"Meg Ryan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000402/","name":"Carrie Fisher"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001661/","name":"Rob Reiner"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0040620/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0020346/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0020346/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001188/","name":"Nora Ephron"}],"duration":"PT1H35M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 0098635, Title: When Harry Met Sally.., --- Description: When Harry Met Sally...: Directed by Rob Reiner. With Billy Crystal, Meg Ryan, Carrie Fisher, Bruno Kirby. Harry and Sally have known each other for years, and are very good friends, but they fear sex would ruin the friendship." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0098635/","name":"When Harry Met Sally...","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjE0ODEwNjM2NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMjU2Mzg3NA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Harry and Sally have known each other for years, and are very good friends, but they fear sex would ruin the friendship.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0098635/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"ajdagreat","dateCreated":"2001-06-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"not just a chick flick","reviewBody":"This movie is not just your average chick flick tearjerker romance movie. I'm sure that a lot of guys can relate to this movie as well.

 First of all, there are some hilarious lines in this movie that will appeal to men and women. Second, the orgasm scene in the restaurant has got to be one of the funniest scenes in movie history. And finally, the guys will be cheering on Billy Crystal, as he makes love to a LOT of women in this movie. I really enjoyed this movie, and I'm pretty sure that I am a guy (I'll check later). 

Billy Crystal and Meg Ryan will remind everyone of their everyday lives in this true-to-life (and very funny) movie. So guys, don't reject "When Harry Met Sally..." just because women cried at it. Perhaps it was a North American v UK humour issue but more likely the fact that the London audience was much better acquainted with the person around whom it was based.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":5894,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.7,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2020-02-21","keywords":"husband wife relationship,fashion industry,fashion show,flashback within a flashback within a flashback,greece","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3277897497","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmE3YTYwNTItZDYwNy00OTk5LTg4MGEtZjFhMDMxMzJmYTM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQUlNRGJWaWRlb1RodW1ibmFpbFNlcnZpY2U@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmE3YTYwNTItZDYwNy00OTk5LTg4MGEtZjFhMDMxMzJmYTM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQUlNRGJWaWRlb1RodW1ibmFpbFNlcnZpY2U@._V1_.jpg","description":"'Greed' tells the story of self-made British billionaire Sir Richard McCreadie (Steve Coogan), whose retail empire is in crisis. To save his reputation, he decides to bounce back with a highly publicized and extravagant party celebrating his 60th birthday on the Greek island of Mykonos. A satire on the grotesque inequality of wealth in the fashion industry, the film sees McCreadie’s rise and fall through the eyes of his biographer, Nick (David Mitchell).\r\n","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1102585/","name":"Caroline Flack","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0176869/","name":"Steve Coogan","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0593267/","name":"David Mitchell"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0935863/","name":"Michael Winterbottom"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0197272/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0103733/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0660299/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0935863/","name":"Michael Winterbottom","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2366133/","name":"Sean Gray"],"duration":"PT1H44M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: De l'autre côté du lit
Auf der anderen Seite des Bettes
programme.desc: De l'autre côté du lit: Directed by Pascale Pouzadoux. With Sophie Marceau, Dany Boon, Antoine Duléry, Roland Giraud. To save their marriage, a man and a woman decide to exchange their lives for a year." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1275590/","name":"De l'autre côté du lit","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMGEwNTE3MzUtOWNmOS00N2Q2LWI2MDAtZGNhODI3NDM4N2U3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzQzNzQxNzI@._V1_.jpg","description":"To save their marriage, a man and a woman decide to exchange their lives for a year.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1275590/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"aleena_m"},"dateCreated":"2012-03-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"Take it for what it is","reviewBody":"Before deciding if I want to see a movie or not, I usually do 2 things: I check out the IMDb vote and I see the trailer. To tell you the truth I did this quite a long time ago for this one, so I looked at the vote again before hitting the play button. You can imagine that my expectations were quite low: a 5.2 out of 10 isn't that much and the 3 reviews out there were so critical. I decided to see it anyway imagining that I will at least have a different experience given that the movies I normally watch are Hollywood productions. I must say I actually enjoyed it! I took it as a comedy, not as a documentary! I saw people were complaining about the fact that the situations were highly unlikely or that the movie was inspired from a book and it didn't do it justice. Well movies rarely succeed in doing that as far as I know... Books and movies are 2 distinct experiences! I liked the fact that there was little or no vulgarity and a complete lack of fart/bodily fluids/coarse sex jokes that I see too often! I don't find those funny! It's way more difficult to make people laugh because of funny circumstances or truly intelligent or sarcastic lines! To wrap it up without giving anything away, take it as a light-hearted comedy and don't have too high expectations - you might actually enjoy it ;)","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2584,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.5},"genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2009-01-07","keywords":"role reversal,switched identity,f rated,singing in a car,family relationships","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000521/","name":"Sophie Marceau"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0200702/","name":"Dany Boon"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0241383/","name":"Antoine Duléry"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0693903/","name":"Pascale Pouzadoux"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0233587/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0079764/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0257823/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3248435/","name":"Alix Girod de l'Ain"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0693903/","name":"Pascale Pouzadoux"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0897065/","name":"Grégoire Vigneron"}],"duration":"PT1H33M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Raising Arizona
Arizona Junior
programme.desc: Raising Arizona: Directed by Joel Coen, Ethan Coen. With Nicolas Cage, Holly Hunter, Trey Wilson, John Goodman. When a childless couple of an ex-con and an ex-cop decide to help themselves to one of another family's quintuplets, their lives become more complicated than they anticipated." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0093822/","name":"Raising Arizona","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGUwZTEwZTYtZmQ0OS00NmM1LWE2ZTQtNjZiYmE4ZmUxMjk1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"When a childless couple of an ex-con and an ex-cop decide to help themselves to one of another family's quintuplets, their lives become more complicated than they anticipated.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0093822/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Sandcooler"},"dateCreated":"2009-07-04","inLanguage":"English","name":"Brilliant oddball comedy","reviewBody":"There are really few directors that are as consistent as the Coen brothers. Their strange sense of humour just works in every movie they make, and it's extremely fun and addictive. With that said, it's difficult to decide which of their movies is the best, but this one is a worthy contender. It's incredibly outrageous, wild and crazy, but at the same time it's close and heart-warming. It has a very surreal look, yet the emotional scenes still look very genuine, which is quite an achievement. The characters are also vintage Coen, they're all offbeat and weird, but that just raises more sympathy for them. It also helps that they all express themselves through some razor-sharp dialogues. I could barely make out the lines because I was too busy laughing at the previous lines, you wonder where these keep coming from. This movie just isn't like anything I've ever seen. It's astoundingly funny in all its weirdness.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":132762,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.3},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Crime"],"datePublished":"1987-04-17","keywords":"arizona desert,state name in title,arizona,phoenix arizona,diaper","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"'Buster Scruggs': The Coen Bros.' Misunderstood, Misanthropic Masterwork","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2967845401","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTUwNjc0MmMtYTk0MC00NTNjLWJlMzYtN2U2Njg5MjM2MjZhXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFsZWxvZw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTUwNjc0MmMtYTk0MC00NTNjLWJlMzYtN2U2Njg5MjM2MjZhXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFsZWxvZw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"We're rootin' and tootin' about the Coen Brothers' new movie, but wasn't this supposed to be their first TV mini-series? On your IMDbrief, we look at the misunderstood, misanthropic masterwork that is, 'The Ballad of Buster Scruggs.'"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000115/","name":"Nicolas Cage"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000456/","name":"Holly Hunter"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0934254/","name":"Trey Wilson"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001054/","name":"Joel Coen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001053/","name":"Ethan Coen"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0039098/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001053/","name":"Ethan Coen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001054/","name":"Joel Coen"}],"duration":"PT1H34M"}</script><metacontent="

Years after a nervous breakdown Karl goes on tour with old friends and upcoming electronic music DJs. Beeing the only sober person in a environment full of drugs and alcohol starts to bring back demons." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt5645006/","name":"Magical Mystery oder: die Rückkehr des Karl Schmidt","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzkzMjIxNDAtZmVhYy00YTU1LWE2NjAtOWIwYjZjM2Q5NGFlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjQ3NzUxOTM@._V1_.jpg","description":"Years after a nervous breakdown Karl goes on tour with old friends and upcoming electronic music DJs. Beeing the only sober person in a environment full of drugs and alcohol starts to bring back demons.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt5645006/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"knyomzp"},"dateCreated":"2020-07-15","inLanguage":"English","name":"Mindnumbingly bumm bumm boring","reviewBody":"110 minutes ok roadies are maybe more about the feels but this had very few to none also the humour is very subtle and flat like a high person saying "hey there was a fish" or a drunk person throwing up a few times, i didn't have one laugh the whole movie. The last 20 minutes were excruciantingly slow torturing since i found out it doesn't try to convey a message or has no finale just that his roadie lifestyle is in a way repetitive as his charity work before. On his way he has a little romance which also is very random and felt empty unrealistic even cold. In some scenes his madness/illness flares up but nothing follows. A waste of the cast some actors are good but this barely showcased them. The Soundtrack was good and had many great 90s Techno songs but i am unsure if they even wanted to relieve these days from the Ravers since they didn't try by expressive neon colorful clothing, whistles,plateau boots, pair of flares, colored hair,spike hair,batik dyeing, feels like they didn't even try even no cool dance moves just a few pictures of some masses dancing. Karl doesn't drink or take drugs since he was a nutcase he just watches people do so or them taking pills but he only chainsmokes everything is shown from his bland workers perspective mostly as the driver but also nanny or barkepper. I've seen musicvideos that were emotional deeper funnier and had more plot than this movie.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":1}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":850,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"genre":["Comedy","Drama","Music"],"datePublished":"2017-08-31","keywords":"female nudity,topless female nudity,smoking after sex,smoking in bed","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3556818713","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGFhZTBiNzUtNjE3My00ZTAzLWJkMTYtNzFlMTE3OTE2ODM2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGFhZTBiNzUtNjE3My00ZTAzLWJkMTYtNzFlMTE3OTE2ODM2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1554735/","name":"Charly Hübner"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6103700/","name":"Annika Meier"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0118345/","name":"Detlev Buck"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0270990/","name":"Arne Feldhusen"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0061958/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0164664/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0254210/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1210638/","name":"Sven Regener"}],"duration":"PT1H51M"}</script><metacontent="

Harry und Sally
programme.desc:
When Harry Met Sally...: Directed by Rob Reiner. With Billy Crystal, Meg Ryan, Carrie Fisher, Bruno Kirby. Harry and Sally have known each other for years, and are very good friends, but they fear sex would ruin the friendship." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0098635/","name":"When Harry Met Sally...","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjE0ODEwNjM2NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMjU2Mzg3NA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Harry and Sally have known each other for years, and are very good friends, but they fear sex would ruin the friendship.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0098635/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ajdagreat"},"dateCreated":"2001-06-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"not just a chick flick","reviewBody":"This movie is not just your average chick flick tearjerker romance movie. I'm sure that a lot of guys can relate to this movie as well.

 First of all, there are some hilarious lines in this movie that will appeal to men and women. Second, the orgasm scene in the restaurant has got to be one of the funniest scenes in movie history. And finally, the guys will be cheering on Billy Crystal, as he makes love to a LOT of women in this movie. I really enjoyed this movie, and I'm pretty sure that I am a guy (I'll check later). 

Billy Crystal and Meg Ryan will remind everyone of their everyday lives in this true-to-life (and very funny) movie. So guys, don't reject "When Harry Met Sally..." just because women cried at it. And girls, if you see this movie, you will probably want to see it another 50 times."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":206277,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"1989-07-21","keywords":"male female friendship,opposites attract,fake orgasm,new york,pessimist","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi129743385","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjYyZjk1ZDMtMGJmZC00YmI0LWJhYTYtYzA1MDcyN2JhOTU3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjYyZjk1ZDMtMGJmZC00YmI0LWJhYTYtYzA1MDcyN2JhOTU3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000345/","name":"Billy Crystal"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000212/","name":"Meg Ryan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000402/","name":"Carrie Fisher"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001661/","name":"Rob Reiner"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0040620/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0020346/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0020346/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001188/","name":"Nora Ephron"}],"duration":"PT1H35M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Shanghai Knights
Shanghai Knights
programme.desc:
Shanghai Knights: Directed by David Dobkin. With Jackie Chan, Owen Wilson, Aaron Taylor-Johnson, Tom Fisher. When a Chinese rebel murders Chon's estranged father and escapes to England, Chon and Roy make their way to London with revenge on their minds." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0300471/","name":"Shanghai Knights","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTMxMTgwOTI3Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwMTI2NDQ3._V1_.jpg","description":"When a Chinese rebel murders Chon's estranged father and escapes to England, Chon and Roy make their way to London with revenge on their minds.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0300471/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Renaldo Matlin"},"dateCreated":"2003-12-27","inLanguage":"English","name":"Fantastic sequel!","reviewBody":"It's an odd thing, this syndrome where people seem to automatically dislike a sequel more than the original. I don't know whether its subconscious or what but the IMDb proves it; Almost everywhere I go, people seem to agree (at least movie lovers) that "Aliens" is even better than "Alien", yet "Aliens" is listed #85 on IMDb's top 250, "Alien" is #61. Then there is another masterpiece: "The Godfather", all though many people seem to agree that however great, "The Godfather Part II" is even better. Not so according to the votes from IMDb-users: "The Godfather" is #1, "Part II" is #4. "Star Wars" is #10, "The Empire Strikes Back" is #15, and the list goes on and on. It's as if the general public goes into sequel-sucks-mode before they see the film and automatically would give it a lower grade no matter what. This also seems to be the case with "Shanghai Knights". Like many of my movie geek friends I thought the first film was great, but "Shanghai Knights" took me by great surprise and turned out to be even better, much more fun, better fights, greater villains, greater scenery, bigger plot, more film references, and I can go on. Still, it gets a 6,4 average while the first one gets a 6,7. Apparently it is one of the laws of physics that all though you personally feel a sequel outdoes the original, the masses would have you believe otherwise (the "Toy Story"-movies being the exception that proves the rule).

Well, we're all better off without the masses anyway. That's why nature invented things like the plague!

Now to my review of "Shanghai Knights":

I rarely laugh out loud to comedies unless it's Monty Python-type comedy filled with unpredictable insane humour, but "Shanghai Knights" had me in stitches several times. I really liked the first film, but the sequel is filled with references to everything you ever found fascinating about Britain and the charming duo of Chan and Wilson this time reaches its peak. But what really gets this film going is fight scenes like you've never seen them before! I am serious, I've watched Jackie Chan-films since I was a little kid and everyone knows he is the Buster Keaton of martial arts, but this time the fights  choreographed by Jackie himself  are so exhilarating to watch, boasting with playfulness to such a degree it leaves you dumbstruck in awe. All though it is apparent they used wires on some of the stunts, the mix of wire- and wireless stunts seem to balance themselves perfectly, giving a show fit for the greatest circus on Earth! It is hard to put to words the sheer delight it is to watch Jackie Chan (now close to 50!) beating up a gang of crooks while at the same time doing an homage to Gene Kelly and "Singin' in the Rain"! It gave me that rare sensation I remember getting the first time I saw Chaplin perform the "dance of the rolls" in the "Gold Rush", Buster Keaton caught in the middle of that hurricane in "Steamboat Bill Jr." or when Donald O'Connor ran up the wall in "Singin' in the Rain". It is a rare cinematic treat, created by and performed to excellence by Jackie Chan, again underlining what a rare and unique screen artist he is and how grateful we should be for him risking his back to give us that joy. People who still think of him as only a martial arts artist should take a hike. He's been a legend in his own right for close to two decades, one of the greatest entertainers of his generation (if not THEE greatest) so I ask you this: when will they give him an Honorary Academy Award!? I am sure Chaplin, Keaton and Gene Kelly would have supported this wholeheartedly, had they been alive today!

A great deal is also owed to the writing pair of Alfred Gough and Miles Millar (Made Men, Spider-Man 2) who pepper the story with quirky charm  the type Chan & Wilson seem born to play, once in a while serving up hysterical one-liners that should crack up anyone with an IQ over 50 (the best one has to be the subtitle after one of the characters has an encounter with Jack the Ripper).

Not surprisingly many of the people with an IQ *under* 50 bothered to fill the Goof-section up with all the factual errors in "Shanghai Knights" when it is just the thing you have to expect from a crazy comedy of this kind. For as long as I can remember I've enjoyed British history, I know the first real automobile wasn't invented until 1889, I'm a big fan of the Jack the Ripper-legend who terrorized London in 1888, I love the work of Chaplin who was born in 1889, I know Arthur Conan Doyle was originally a doctor of optometry, but not once did I mind all these things clashing in 1887's London, it is pure fantasy and should be enjoyed as such. Wonderful escapism played to perfection by great talent in front of and behind the camera. The writers didn't intend to re-create history, they just did as Jackie Chan would do in a fight: take every thing available and throw it in to make it more entertaining to the viewer! Then again there are people who have NO relation to any of the above-listed things and not surprisingly they won't find "Shanghai Knights" that entertaining. Which is really sad, for if you love movies you should *really* learn to love history as well, as the two can make a fabulous pair whether it is done in the name of fantasy or fiction. 

Of course director David Dobkin also deserves special praise for never letting the heart and soul of the film getting lost in all the commotion.

I didn't mention Owen Wilson in all this, but don't get me wrong, he's great as usual. Wilson and Chris Tucker (Rush Hour) has to be the greatest thing happening to Jackie Chan since he discovered the art of mixing comedy with martial arts. And of course the supporting actors deserves mentioning, especially Aidan Gillen who makes a wonderful sneaky upper-class villain (named Rathbone, not exactly the most inventive referance to Hollywood  legendary actor Basil Rathbone - but still wonderful the same) and Aaron Johnson as a kid who looks and acts like he was just pulled out of "Oliver!" with great conviction (a scene where Wilson tells him of for being a an orphan is both heartbreaking and side-splittingly funny at the same time). Fann Wong also does a great English language-speaking film debut as Jackie Chan's sister.

To sum it all up; leaving me laughing to the point of exhaustion, "Shanghai Knights" is one of this years most pleasant surprises!"},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":103441,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2003-03-26","keywords":"charlie chaplin character,queen victoria character,good versus evil,sir arthur conan doyle character,over the mouth gag","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000329/","name":"Jackie Chan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005562/","name":"Owen Wilson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0939056/","name":"Fann Wong"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0229694/","name":"David Dobkin"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0049348/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0031181/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0302434/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0332184/","name":"Alfred Gough"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0587692/","name":"Miles Millar"}],"duration":"PT1H54M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Fack ju Göhte 3
Fack Ju Göhte 3
programme.desc: Fack ju Göhte 3: Directed by Bora Dagtekin. With Elyas M'Barek, Katja Riemann, Jella Haase, Sandra Hüller. A bank robber becomes a teacher after being released from prison and finds himself at the center of a number of crazy adventures." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6471264/","name":"Fack ju Göhte 3","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjlkYWJjZDItNzA2OS00ZWZjLTg4NmItNWRjMjJjNTZlODU2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjQ3NzUxOTM@._V1_.jpg","description":"A bank robber becomes a teacher after being released from prison and finds himself at the center of a number of crazy adventures.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6471264/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Breumaster"},"dateCreated":"2020-02-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"Too Much Over the Top","reviewBody":"The movie has some funny scenes, but also too much gross-out humour. It wouldn't be that, if it wasn't so over the top trying to be funny. On the other hand I do admire, that German movie makers at last try to come out having gut to go better ways. The main problem with Germans movie business is, that they always try to do a movie that has a deeper meaning - and then the movies become boring, except those movies about the second world war. I consider this as a new attempt to bring freshness into German cinema. Not the worst, not the best. I hope they keep the way and will be better in next productions. The movie itself tells, that this is the last part of this series. I hope the next projects will be less hectic and over-excited, but better - in a new way.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":5440,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.4},"genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2017-10-26","keywords":"singing in a car,female teacher,teacher student relationship,teacher student conflict,munich germany","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4153260825","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTBhZGNlYTctYmYxYi00YmU2LTlhMDItN2E0ZjRjNzU4NmNiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTBhZGNlYTctYmYxYi00YmU2LTlhMDItN2E0ZjRjNzU4NmNiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1065929/","name":"Elyas M'Barek"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0726257/","name":"Katja Riemann"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3436464/","name":"Jella Haase"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1480916/","name":"Bora Dagtekin"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002257/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1480916/","name":"Bora Dagtekin"}],"duration":"PT2H"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Harry Potter und der Gefangene von Askaban
programme.desc:
Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban: Directed by Alfonso Cuarón. With Daniel Radcliffe, Richard Griffiths, Pam Ferris, Fiona Shaw. Harry Potter, Ron and Hermione return to Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry for their third year of study, where they delve into the mystery surrounding an escaped prisoner who poses a dangerous threat to the young wizard." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0304141/","name":"Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY4NTIwODg0N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwOTc0MjEzMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Harry Potter, Ron and Hermione return to Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry for their third year of study, where they delve into the mystery surrounding an escaped prisoner who poses a dangerous threat to the young wizard.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0304141/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ccthemovieman-1"},"dateCreated":"2008-02-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"My Favorite Of The Harry Potter Films","reviewBody":"I thought this was excellent....better than the first two Harry Potter movies combined and better than what has followed.. That's my feeling, and I'm still sticking to it.

This was just great fun, right from the opening. In fact, the early bus scene is the best in the film. Overall, the movie didn't have as mean an edge to it as the others, although it has a number of scary moments (which might have warranted a PG-13 rating). That was fine with me. I got tired of the dark, nasty and/or annoying characters of the first two films, and especially the irritating blonde wise-guy kid. I give this major points for cutting his role down. Even Alan Rickman's character softens.

In other words, there is no despicable villain to hate throughout the film, which I thought was refreshing. Instead, we just go through one adventure after another until the final surprise ending.

Along the way are a lot of fun special effects and scenery, some humor (Emma Thompson is a hoot as an eccentric tea-leaf reader) and some fantastic 5.1 surround sound. I wish all the Harry Potter films were like this one.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":583957,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.9},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Adventure","Family","Fantasy"],"datePublished":"2004-06-03","keywords":"magic,wizard,werewolf,rat,school of magic","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2007761177","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA4OTU3ZjctYTBmNi00MTk2LTlhZTgtZWQyMmM1MmI5NmQ1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA4OTU3ZjctYTBmNi00MTk2LTlhZTgtZWQyMmM1MmI5NmQ1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Warner Home Video"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0705356/","name":"Daniel Radcliffe"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0914612/","name":"Emma Watson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0342488/","name":"Rupert Grint"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0190859/","name":"Alfonso Cuarón"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002663/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046151/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0159772/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0746830/","name":"J.K. Rowling"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0460141/","name":"Steve Kloves"}],"duration":"PT2H22M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire
Harry Potter und der Feuerkelch
programme.desc: Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire: Directed by Mike Newell. With Eric Sykes, Timothy Spall, David Tennant, Daniel Radcliffe. Harry Potter finds himself competing in a hazardous tournament between rival schools of magic, but he is distracted by recurring nightmares." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0330373/","name":"Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTI1NDMyMjExOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwOTc4MjQzMQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Harry Potter finds himself competing in a hazardous tournament between rival schools of magic, but he is distracted by recurring nightmares.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0330373/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"AetherTheory"},"dateCreated":"2005-11-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"Shortest 2.5 hour movie","reviewBody":"Mike Newell is forgiven for cutting out so much detail from the book, and JK Rowling is forgiven for writing wonderfully rich books. However, fans of the book cannot help but feel like riding a roller coaster that is so fast there is no time to enjoy the ride. I predict the huge void between book and movie will spur remakes in about 10 to 20 years. Even if the movies must be 5 hours long, Harry Potter fans are willing to sit through them. This movie doesn't get a 10 because it leaves me feeling like something is missing, but it does deserve a 9 for being the best possible portrayal of the book given a 2.5 hour limitation. All said and done, this is the shortest 2.5 hour movie I have ever watched.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":577895,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.7},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Adventure","Family","Fantasy"],"datePublished":"2005-11-23","keywords":"tournament,wizard,magic,school of magic,heroism","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2611740953","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTY3NzkxMjMtZjMwNy00OTYwLWJhNDktZDgwZDZmMzZmOWNkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTY3NzkxMjMtZjMwNy00OTYwLWJhNDktZDgwZDZmMzZmOWNkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Warner Home Video"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0705356/","name":"Daniel Radcliffe"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0914612/","name":"Emma Watson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0342488/","name":"Rupert Grint"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001565/","name":"Mike Newell"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002663/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0159772/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0176128/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0460141/","name":"Steve Kloves"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0746830/","name":"J.K.
